§Parenthood

I might have §Liking without §Wanting for parenthood. Evolutionarily, we might've been optimised for wanting sex, since that was enough for parenthood – and then the §Liking steps in when the child is born.

Parenthood is more likely to increase my life satisfaction if I choose it willingly (Considering projects integrates motivations). This means that exploring reasons for becoming a parent is a good idea.

The major determinant is whether children will increase my life satisfaction, ie. whether it'll allow me to better satisfy my values by bringing goals that I'd prefer to the the goals I could accomplish had I not become a parent (§Clarify your values to know which actions to take).

Some factors mean that I'm more likely to derive less satisfaction from parenthood than average:

I need more sleep than average, Parenthood takes energy

I have more time spent on interests than average, Parenthood takes time, Parenthood takes energy

I'm more deliberate than average/have more purpose

  • If I have a time-consuming, purpose-giving activity, children are more likely to cause problems

Time

  • Parenthood takes time
  • My parents are going to be under high load

Relationship stability is moderate

And some that I'll derive more satisfaction:

I'm better at conflict management I care tremendously I like teaching I am emotionally stable

Time

  • Miekes and my parents are both willing to support

Money

  • I will have an above average income

I believe that:

  • Parenthood requires excellence

  • Parenthood takes time

  • Parenthood takes energy

  • Parenthood is costly

  • Parenthood decreases solitude

  • Parenthood decreases relationship satisfaction, Value caring

    • Parenthood may challenge intimacy

  • Parenthood drains friendships

  • Parenthood interferes with work

  • Parenthood leads to less exploration

  • Parenthood blocks fun

Log: Do I want parenthood

Being a father would allow me to keep the family line going, to further the human race and to show love and compassion to two little humans that'll depend on me for a huge chunk of their lives.

Backlinks

  • The Baby Decision
    • See also §Parenthood
  • Variation is the spice of life
    • However, a change in life that lowers variation can be indicated if it leads to strong, meaningful experiences (and satisfaction of BPN), eg. §Parenthood.
